member.remarks: In case the download fails will contain the exception that cause the failure. The only exception which will be thrown is which indicates that the task was canceled.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Download.MediaDownloader.CountedBuffer.RemoveFromFront(System.Int32)

member.param: The number of bytes to remove.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Download.MediaDownloader.DownloadCoreAsync(System.String,System.IO.Stream,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary:
The core download logic. We download the media and write it to an output stream ChunkSize bytes at a time, raising the ProgressChanged event after each chunk.
The chunking behavior is largely a historical artifact: a previous implementation issued multiple web requests, each for ChunkSize bytes. Now we do everything in one request, but the API and client-visible behavior are retained for compatibility.
member.param: The URL of the resource to download.
The download will download the resource into this stream.
A cancellation token to cancel this download in the middle.
member.returns: A task with the download progress object. If an exception occurred during the download, its property will contain the exception.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Download.MediaDownloader.OnResponseReceived(System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage)
member.summary: Called when a successful HTTP response is received, allowing subclasses to examine headers.
member.remarks: For unsuccessful responses, an appropriate exception is thrown immediately, without this method being called.
member.param: HTTP response received.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Download.MediaDownloader.OnDataReceived(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Called when an HTTP response is received, allowing subclasses to examine data before it's written to the client stream.
member.param: Byte array containing the data downloaded.
Length of data downloaded in this chunk, in bytes.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Download.MediaDownloader.OnDownloadCompleted
member.summary: Called when a download has completed, allowing subclasses to perform any final validation or transformation.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.ETagAction
member.summary: Defines the behaviour/header used for sending an etag along with a request.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.ETagAction.Default
member.summary: The default etag behaviour will be determined by the type of the request.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.ETagAction.Ignore
member.summary: The ETag won't be added to the header of the request.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.ETagAction.IfMatch
member.summary: The ETag will be added as an "If-Match" header. A request sent with an "If-Match" header will only succeed if both ETags are identical.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.ETagAction.IfNoneMatch
member.summary: The ETag will be added as an "If-None-Match" header. A request sent with an "If-Match" header will only succeed if both ETags are not identical.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Requests.BatchRequest
member.summary:
A batch request which represents individual requests to Google servers. You should add a single service request using the method and execute all individual requests using . More information about the batch protocol is available in https://developers.google.com/storage/docs/json_api/v1/how-tos/batch.
Current implementation doesn't retry on unsuccessful individual response and doesn't support requests with different access tokens (different users or scopes).

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Requests.BatchRequest.OnResponse`1
member.summary: A concrete type callback for an individual response.
member.param: The content response or null if the request failed.

The request index.
The HTTP individual response.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Requests.PageStreamer`4
member.summary: A page streamer is a helper to provide both synchronous and asynchronous page streaming of a listable or queryable resource.

remarks.para: The expected usage pattern is to create a single paginator for a resource collection, and then use the instance methods to obtain paginated results.

member.typeparam: The type of resource being paginated
The type of request used to fetch pages
The type of response obtained when fetching pages
The type of the "next page token", which must be a reference type; a null reference for a token indicates the end of a stream of pages.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Requests.PageStreamer`4.#ctor(System.Action{`1,`3},System.Func{`2,`3},System.Func{`2,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{`0}})
member.summary: Creates a paginator for later use.
member.param: Action to modify a request to include the specified page token. Must not be null.
Function to extract the next page token from a response. Must not be null.
Function to extract a sequence of resources from a response. Must not be null, although it can return null if it is passed a response which contains no resources.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Requests.PageStreamer`4.Fetch(`1)
member.summary: Lazily fetches resources a page at a time.
member.param: The initial request to send. If this contains a page token, that token is maintained. This will be modified with new page tokens over time, and should not be changed by the caller. (The caller should clone the request if they want an independent object to use in other calls or to modify.) Must not be null.
member.returns: A sequence of resources, which are fetched a page at a time. Must not be null.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Requests.PageStreamer`4.FetchAllAsync(`1,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously (but eagerly) fetches a complete set of resources, potentially making multiple requests.
member.param: The initial request to send. If this contains a page token, that token is maintained. This will be modified with new page tokens over time, and should not be changed by the caller. (The caller should clone the request if they want an independent object to use in other calls or to modify.) Must not be null.
member.returns: A sequence of resources, which are fetched asynchronously and a page at a time.
A task whose result (when complete) is the complete set of results fetched starting with the given request, and continuing to make further requests until a response has no "next page" token.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Services.BaseClientService
member.summary: A base class for a client service which provides common mechanism for all services, like serialization and GZip support. It should be safe to use a single service instance to make server requests concurrently from multiple threads. This class adds a special to the execute interceptor list, which uses the given Authenticator. It calls to its applying authentication method, and injects the "Authorization" header in the request. If the given Authenticator implements , this class adds the Authenticator to the 's unsuccessful response handler list.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Services.BaseClientService.Logger
member.summary: The class logger.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Services.BaseClientService.DefaultMaxUrlLength
member.summary: The default maximum allowed length of a URL string for GET requests.

member.summary: An initializer class for the client service.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Services.BaseClientService.Initializer.HttpClientFactory
member.summary: Gets or sets the factory for creating instance. If this property is not set the service uses a new instance.

member.summary: Gets or sets a HTTP client initializer which is able to customize properties on and .

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Services.BaseClientService.Initializer.DefaultExponentialBackOffPolicy
member.summary: Get or sets the exponential back-off policy used by the service. Default value is UnsuccessfulResponse503, which means that exponential back-off is used on 503 abnormal HTTP response. If the value is set to None, no exponential back-off policy is used, and it's up to the user to configure the in an to set a specific back-off implementation (using ).

member.summary: Gets or sets whether this service supports GZip. Default value is true.

member.summary: Gets or sets the serializer. Default value is .

member.summary: Maximum allowed length of a URL string for GET requests. Default value is 2048. If the value is set to 0, requests will never be modified due to URL string length.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Upload.IUploadSessionData
member.summary: Interface IUploadSessionData: Provides UploadUri for client to persist. Allows resuming an upload after a program restart for seekable ContentStreams.
member.remarks: Defines the data passed from the ResumeableUpload class upon initiation of an upload. When the client application adds an event handler for the UploadSessionData event, the data defined in this interface (currently the UploadURI) is passed as a parameter to the event handler procedure. An event handler for the UploadSessionData event is only required if the application will support resuming the upload after a program restart.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Upload.IUploadSessionData.UploadUri
member.summary: The resumable session URI (UploadUri)

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload
member.summary: Media upload which uses Google's resumable media upload protocol to upload data.
member.remarks: See: https://developers.google.com/drive/manage-uploads#resumable for more information on the protocol.

member.summary: The class logger.

member.summary: Minimum chunk size (except the last one). Default value is 256*KB.

member.summary: Default chunk size. Default value is 10*MB.

member.name: F:Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload.BufferSize

member.summary: Indicates the stream's size is unknown.

member.summary: Gets or sets the length of the steam. Will be if the media content length is unknown.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload.LastMediaRequest
member.summary: Gets or sets the content of the last buffer request to the server or null. It is used when the media content length is unknown, for resending it in case of server error. Only used with a non-seekable stream.

member.summary: Gets or sets the last request length. Only used with a non-seekable stream.

member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of bytes the server had received so far.

member.summary: Change this value ONLY for testing purposes!

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload.ChunkSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of each chunk sent to the server. Chunks (except the last chunk) must be a multiple of to be compatible with Google upload servers.

member.summary: Event called whenever the progress of the upload changes.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload.ServerErrorCallback
member.summary: Callback class that is invoked on abnormal response or an exception. This class changes the request to query the current status of the upload in order to find how many bytes were successfully uploaded before the error occurred. See https://developers.google.com/drive/manage-uploads#resume-upload for more details.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload.ServerErrorCallback.#ctor(Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload)
member.summary: Constructs a new callback and register it as unsuccessful response handler and exception handler on the configurable message handler.

member.summary: Changes the request in order to resume the interrupted upload.

member.name: E:Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload.UploadSessionData
member.summary: Event called when an UploadUri is created. Not needed if the application program will not support resuming after a program restart.
member.remarks: Within the event, persist the UploadUri to storage. It is strongly recommended that the full path filename (or other media identifier) is also stored so that it can be compared to the current open filename (media) upon restart.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload.ResumeableUploadSessionData
member.summary: Data to be passed to the application program to allow resuming an upload after a program restart.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload.ResumeableUploadSessionData.#ctor(System.Uri)
member.summary: Create a ResumeableUploadSessionData instance to pass the UploadUri to the client.
member.param: The resumable session URI.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload.SendUploadSessionData(Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload.ResumeableUploadSessionData)
member.summary: Send data (UploadUri) to application so it can store it to persistent storage.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload.Upload
member.summary: Uploads the content to the server. This method is synchronous and will block until the upload is completed.
member.remarks: In case the upload fails the will contain the exception that cause the failure.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload.UploadAsync
member.summary: Uploads the content asynchronously to the server.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload.UploadAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Uploads the content to the server using the given cancellation token.
member.remarks: In case the upload fails will contain the exception that cause the failure. The only exception which will be thrown is which indicates that the task was canceled.
member.param: A cancellation token to cancel operation.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload.Resume
member.summary: Resumes the upload from the last point it was interrupted. Use when resuming and the program was not restarted.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload.Resume(System.Uri)
member.summary: Resumes the upload from the last point it was interrupted. Use when the program was restarted and you wish to resume the upload that was in progress when the program was halted. Implemented only for ContentStreams where .CanSeek is True.
member.remarks: In your application's UploadSessionData Event Handler, store UploadUri.AbsoluteUri property value (resumable session URI string value) to persistent storage for use with Resume() or ResumeAsync() upon a program restart. It is strongly recommended that the FullPathFilename of the media file that is being uploaded is saved also so that a subsequent execution of the program can compare the saved FullPathFilename value to the FullPathFilename of the media file that it has opened for uploading. You do not need to seek to restart point in the ContentStream file.
member.param: VideosResource.InsertMediaUpload UploadUri property value that was saved to persistent storage during a prior execution.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload.ResumeAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously resumes the upload from the last point it was interrupted.
member.remarks: You do not need to seek to restart point in the ContentStream file.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload.ResumeAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously resumes the upload from the last point it was interrupted. Use when resuming and the program was not restarted.
member.remarks: You do not need to seek to restart point in the ContentStream file.
member.param: A cancellation token to cancel the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload.ResumeAsync(System.Uri)
member.summary: Asynchronously resumes the upload from the last point it was interrupted. Use when resuming and the program was restarted. Implemented only for ContentStreams where .CanSeek is True.
member.remarks: In your application's UploadSessionData Event Handler, store UploadUri.AbsoluteUri property value (resumable session URI string value) to persistent storage for use with Resume() or ResumeAsync() upon a program restart. It is strongly recommended that the FullPathFilename of the media file that is being uploaded is saved also so that a subsequent execution of the program can compare the saved FullPathFilename value to the FullPathFilename of the media file that it has opened for uploading. You do not need to seek to restart point in the ContentStream file.
member.param: VideosResource.InsertMediaUpload UploadUri property value that was saved to persistent storage during a prior execution.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload.ResumeAsync(System.Uri,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously resumes the upload from the last point it was interrupted. Use when the program was restarted and you wish to resume the upload that was in progress when the program was halted. Implemented only for ContentStreams where .CanSeek is True.
member.remarks: In your application's UploadSessionData Event Handler, store UploadUri.AbsoluteUri property value (resumable session URI string value) to persistent storage for use with Resume() or ResumeAsync() upon a program restart. It is strongly recommended that the FullPathFilename of the media file that is being uploaded is saved also so that a subsequent execution of the program can compare the saved FullPathFilename value to the FullPathFilename of the media file that it has opened for uploading. You do not need to seek to restart point in the ContentStream file.
member.param: VideosResource.InsertMediaUpload UploadUri property value that was saved to persistent storage during a prior execution.
A cancellation token to cancel the asynchronous operation.

member.summary: The core logic for uploading a stream. It is used by the upload and resume methods.

member.summary: Initiates the resumable upload session and returns the session URI, or upload URI. See https://developers.google.com/drive/manage-uploads#start-resumable and https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/json_api/v1/how-tos/resumable-upload#start-resumable for more information.
member.param: The token to monitor for cancellation requests.
member.returns: The task containing the session URI to use for the resumable upload.

member.summary: Prepares the given request with the next chunk in case the steam length is unknown.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload.PrepareNextChunkKnownSize(System.Net.Http.HttpRequestMessage,System.IO.Stream,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Prepares the given request with the next chunk in case the steam length is known.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload.GetNextByte(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the next byte index need to be sent.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Upload.ResumableUpload.GetContentRangeHeader(System.Int64,System.Int64)
member.summary:
Build a content range header of the form: "bytes X-Y/T" where:
X is the first byte being sent.
Y is the last byte in the range being sent (inclusive).
T is the total number of bytes in the range or * for unknown size.
member.remarks: See: RFC2616 HTTP/1.1, Section 14.16 Header Field Definitions, Content-Range http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.16
member.param: Start of the chunk.
Size of the chunk being sent.
